title: Telegraph Travel Awards 2015/16: win a £54,000 holiday in James Bond's Austria
text: This is an exclusive prize to ski in the tracks of James Bond on a once-in-a-lifetime family getaway, taking in the beautiful sights of the Austrian village of Soelden and surrounding area. Staying in the only 5-star hotel in Soelden, the luxurious Das Central, in the Presidential Suite with your own private butler. You will dine in their gourmet ice Q restaurant 3048m above sea level, one of the locations featured in the new James Bond movie SPECTRE. Prize includes spa treatments, private ski instructor, wine tasting, cooking class, VIP access to the wine and food festival, transfers and business class flights. A money-can’t-buy experience, valued at over €73,000. How to enter Follow this link to tell us about your favourite travel companies and destinations - and to enter the draw for one of 27 prizes . You will need to leave your name, telephone number and a valid email address. See here for full terms and conditions . The prize Your prize includes four business class flights into Innsbruck or Munich allowing you to start your holiday in style. You will be chauffeured to the luxurious 5 star Das Central Hotel nestled in the beautiful valley of Soelden in one of the latest BMW models. The package includes a one week stay in the recently launched Presidential Suite with the ultimate luxury of your own private butler and exclusive use of one of the latest BMW models allowing you the freedom to explore Soelden at your own pace. Das Central Hotel is 2 minute shuttle ride to the ski-lift - and the prize includes a 20 minute ride in a private gondola sipping on champagne and soaking up the views of the majestic Gaislachkogl Mountain, before arriving at the top of the peak and ice Q, you will be seated at the chef's table reserved exclusively for you for a sumptuous private lunch including wine. Soelden offers the ultimate winter or summer escape for families. With 145km of pistes for all skiing abilities and an altitude of up to 3,250m, perfect snow conditions are guaranteed from November through to May thanks to the two linked glacier ski areas of Tiefenbach and Rettenbach, and state-of-the-art snow making systems. In the summer months explore the beauty of Soelden through various hiking and biking trails, waterfalls, and take part in over 35 sports at the outdoor adventure venue ‘Area 47’. Enjoy a relaxing spa day at The Aqua Dome Tirol Therme Lagenfeld, sauna and water world with outdoor thermo-mineral pool and beautiful views of the Otzal valley. Skiing in the tracks of Bond with separate two private ski instructors per day for the family, your ski rental and ski passes for a week are included as well as an exclusive one day VIP ski guide with a former Olympic racer and an evening of night skiing in the ice Q with live music and wine. VIP passes to Das Central’s Wein am Berg (food and wine) festival 2016, in its 15th year anniversary. Private wine tasting with the head Sommelier Martin Sperdin of Das Central in their own private wine cellar and a cooking class with Head Chef Gottfried Prantl. Also Included are two private dinners in the Presidential suite with toque-rated menu and wine. After your busy day of skiing, cycling or food and wine tasting you will be ready for a relaxing treatment in Das Central’s Venetian inspired spa: included is one treatment per person per day. Not forgetting a bottle of PINO 3000 wine to take home and toast your amazing holiday whilst thinking it was all a dream. The prize provider Das Central defines a holiday in Sölden at the highest level of casual luxury. Alpine joie de vivre, charming hospitality and a natural setting which is magically alluring, making this family run only 5-star hotel in Sölden your first port of call in the hotspot of the Alps. For those looking for relaxation with a hint of exclusivity for exacting alpinists, fastidious families and well-travelled individuals Das Central as a special hideaway with 40-years’ experience. A cordial ‘Grüß Gott’ is as much a feature here as the toque-awarded cuisine, which is of an international standard. The invigorating altitude air and the well-being realms in Das Central at 1500 m² let you breathe a sigh of relief. While Tirol hospitality is characteristic in the top-notch, attentive service – which also accompanies you throughout your enjoyable and adventure-packed day. From June to December 2013 the ice Q was built on Gaislachkogl peak, an outstanding deluxe restaurant with table service, offering gourmet Alpine Cuisine, excellent wines, 94 seats inside, 34 seats on the terrace and an awe-inspiring rooftop terrace.
